document_data.name: Pouch
document_data.mainbody: A '''pouch''' was a container used for carrying small items, such as [[coin]]s, on one's person. They were commonly used as [[adventurer|adventuring]] gear. and pouches were also how children's [[marbles]] were typically stored.
document_data.Description: Most pouches were made of [[leather]] and weighed about {{SI|0.5|lb|long=yes}}. Those made for small folk, such as [[gnome]]s or [[halfling]]s, were about a fourth the size and weighed around {{SI|0.125|lb|long=yes}}. Most could strap to one's belt. They sold in most markets for around 1 [[gold piece]] but could be found in [[Aurora's Emporium]] for only 2 [[silver piece]]s. Merchants selling sling bullets usually included a complimentary pouch with the bullets.

Variations.[[Feedbag]]: A pouch used to feed domesticated animals.
Variations.Seed pouch: This large leather pouch was worn over the hip and used by sowers to carry up to {{SI|100|lb|k|long=yes}} of seed. They were sold by Aurora's Emporium for 2 gold pieces.<ref name="AWRC-p53>
Variations.[[Spell component pouch]]: This pouch was watertight and had special compartments for quick access to tiny [[material component]]s and [[Spell focus|foci]] for [[spell]]s.
Variations.[[Waterskin]]: This pouch had a narrow neck and was used for carrying water.

Spell-Made Pouches.''[[Wrap]]'': Pouches were among the many types of containers that this [[cantrip]] could create from any material. Any pouch created by the spell could hold a maximum volume of {{SI|1|cu yd|long=yes}} and could open by the spellcaster issuing a verbal command.

document_data.Trivia: The word for "pouch" in [[thieves' cant]] was ''byb''.{{Cite dragon/66/Thieves' Cant|37}}
